title: Pedestrians dive for cover as speeding car swerves onto seafront
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Police have launched an investigation after a car drove up and down a Welsh prom, narrowly missing pedestrians.

Shocking footage of the alarming incident shows a dark green car being swerving onto the seafront area in Aberystwyth, at around 4am on Saturday morning.

The vehicle then winds in between benches and parked cars, and at several points appears to be aiming for people who are walking past.

Advertisement

Advertisement

It then comes to a stop on Marine Terrace, where several pedestrians can be seen running forward to try and stop the car.

Two men then jump out the car and start swinging objects at people, before diving back in.

The sped along the prom (Picture: Media Wales)

They then reverse, seemingly hitting one person and causing them to fall backwards, before speeding off.

It is thought the incident resulted from an earlier fight somewhere on Marine Terrace.

One man is recovering in hospital with minor injuries while another man refused medical treatment.

Dyfed-Powys police said three people have been arrested and are now being held in custody.

A spokesman said officers were called to a disturbance near bars and a nightclub.

Pedestrians had to dive out the way (Picture: Media Wales)

He added: ‘The reports then also stated that a dark green car was driving erratically and dangerously in the area, and that it had possibly collided with some pedestrians and the pillar of a shelter on the prom.

‘Three men were arrested on suspicion of affray and driving offences, and remain in police custody currently.

‘Anyone who witnessed the incident or has any information is asked to contact Dyfed-Powys Police.’
